description:
The negative reviews all seem to stem from the fact that one can't move a ball into a space if there is no route to it, horizontally or vertically, and this is not made explicitly clear.
Only play on the smallest board; it's is a very well balanced game of entropy. The biuld up of disorder versus keeping the board clear.
summary: One of the best desktop games

description: Another great example of how good GNOME Games can be, A highly addictive and very well executed GNOME Game

This game makes you plan plan ahead but also to make judgement calls as the game progresses. A game starts out slow and becomes out of your control by the end. Scores are mostly luck-based. The program is clearly unfinished since there's no implemented difficulty setting even though the screenshot and score window shows them. It took me a few tries to figure out how to play too (click on a marble and an open space; it needs to have a clear path). I'd say it's worth trying.
Tells you to line up 5 of the same color then doesn't let you move a ball into the space. Seems random and without explanation. Uninstalling.

It doesn't let me move balls to open cells half the time.
It just says "Can't move there"
Nothing to indicate why, so kind of a waste of time.
Wieso wird so ein Müll im Standard installiert - Spam
summary: Wieso wird so ein Müll im Standard installiert

description: Ich spiele dieses Spiel immer wieder seit ich Linux nutze. Mein persönlicher Hiscore ist bei knapp über 1000. Das geht erst nach einiger Übung.
Muy bonito diseño, es sencillo de jugar y a la vez tiene un buen nivel de dificultad, es decir, ni demasiado fácil ni tan difícil que no se pueda jugar.
